medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had ongoing nausea and vomiting that started one day before the current presentation, which became more severe with the onset of menses. She awoke with nausea and profuse vomiting of dark-brown fluid and had persistent nausea and repeated vomiting over the next 12 hours, accompanied by weakness, light-headedness, and dizziness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of cyclic vomiting syndrome, polysubstance use disorder, nephrolithiasis, asthma, allergic rhinitis, chronic back pain, depression, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and severe dysmenorrhea. Past surgeries include shoulder replacement, reduction mammoplasty, and removal of an ovarian cyst.
medical_history.social_history: The patient previously worked in the pharmaceutical industry but had stopped working 3 months prior to the presentation due to cyclic vomiting syndrome. She does not use tobacco or alcohol, but has a history of using cocaine, heroin, marijuana, and MDMA.
